posts._title: Gee-woong Nam – Daehakno-yeseo maechoon-hadaka tomaksalhae danghan yeogosaeng ajik Daehakno-ye Issda AKA Teenage Hooker Who Died and Became a Killing Machine (2000)
posts.title: Daehakno-yeseo maechoon-hadaka tomaksalhae danghan yeogosaeng ajik Daehakno-ye Issda
posts.excerpt: A sadistic teacher discovers one of his teenage students is a prostitute and blackmails her into becoming his sex slave. When she becomes pregnant, he arranges her demise. His henchmen (who are kind of like the Three Stooges) murder her and chop her up. At this point a mysterious, sunglasses-wearing Dr. Frankenstein-like character intervenes and …
posts.titleEnglish: Teenage Hooker Who Died and Became a Killing Machine

posts.title: Seven Women, Seven Sins
posts.excerpt: Quote:What constitutes a deadly sin today? Seven of the world’s best-known women directors produce their own version of celluloid sin in this omnibus film. Helke Sander (THE GERMANS AND THEIR MEN) reverses GLUTTONY with her vision of Eve forcing her apples into the hands of a reluctant Adam. Bette Gordon (VARIETY, EMPTY SUITCASES) finds GREED …

posts._title: Ming-liang Tsai – Tian bian yi duo yun AKA The Wayward Cloud [+Extras] (2005)
posts.title: Tian bian yi duo yun
posts.excerpt: Quote:Hsiao-Kang, now working as a pornographic actor, meets Shiang-chyi once again. Meanwhile, the city of Taipei faces a water shortage that makes the sales of watermelons skyrocket.

posts._title: Raoul Ruiz – Cofralandes, tercera parte: Museos y clubes en la región antártica (2002)
posts.title: Cofralandes, tercera parte: Museos y clubes en la región antártica
posts.excerpt: Quote:For more than twenty years the films of Ruiz have led us into the fields of uninhibited delirium, free associations, and intricate games of collage. Ruiz, paying no heed to conventions, leads his audience into a labyrinth without a map, without warning and without an Ariadne allowed to help them retrace their steps. “Regulars only” …

posts._title: Jean-Marie Straub – Der Bräutigam, die Komödiantin und der Zuhälter AKA The Bridegroom, the Actress and the Pimp (1968)
posts.title: Der Bräutigam, die Komödiantin und der Zuhälter
posts.excerpt: A short film starring Fassbinder and some of his regular players. From an interview with the director, Straub: “STRAUB: I don’t believe in the cinema. Even when it’s Godard who says these things, it’s interesting and has meaning, but it gives me a stomach ache. I don’t fetishize the cinema at all. I think of …
posts.titleEnglish: The Bridegroom, the Actress and the Pimp

posts._title: Stephen Dwoskin – The Sun and the Moon (2008)
posts.title: The Sun and the Moon
posts.excerpt: A film that seeks a balance between feature, form and lighting essay, with autobiographical elements and echoes of the primeval fairy tale Beauty and the Beast. By the former Film Maker in Focus Stephen Dwoskin. ‘The Sun and the Moon, a film fairy tale, is about two women’s terrifying encounter with ‘Otherness’ in the form …

posts.title: Party
posts.excerpt: Quote:The battle of the sexes? The forces of despair and seduction? On S. Miguel in the Azores, Rogério, a young man with old money, and his enigmatic wife Leonor host a garden party at their villa. The intriguing guests are an older unmarried couple, the philosophical and observant Irene, and Michel, a roué;. While Rogério …

posts._title: Peter Greenaway – The Tulse Luper Suitcases, Part 3: From Sark to the Finish (2004)
posts.title: The Tulse Luper Suitcases, Part 3: From Sark to the Finish
posts.excerpt: Quote:In the third film of the Tulse Luper Suitcases, Luper, writer, collector and archivist, continues his adventures as a professional prisoner during the later years of the Second World War and its aftermath, the Cold War. Luper is shipwrecked on the Paradise Island of Sark and spends three months in self-imposed imprisonment on an idyllic …

posts._title: Peter Greenaway – The Tulse Luper Suitcases, Part 2: Vaux to the Sea (2004)
posts.title: The Tulse Luper Suitcases, Part 2: Vaux to the Sea
posts.excerpt: Quote:This second film in the Tulse Luper Suitcases series, deals with the life and times of Luper and his friends, lovers, jailers and enemies, during the Second World War, in three bizarre prisons, in a chateau at Vaux in Northern France, in a cinema in Strasbourg, and in a collaborationist household on the French coast …

posts._title: Peter Greenaway – The Tulse Luper Suitcases, Part 1: The Moab Story (2003)
posts.title: The Tulse Luper Suitcases, Part 1: The Moab Story
posts.excerpt: Quote:This first film in the Tulse Luper Suitcases Series deals with the adventures of Tulse Luper and his great friend Martino Knockavelli, in three locations, in Newport South Wales, in Moab Utah and in Antwerp Belgium in the two decades before the Second World War.
